title.narrative: Bahia State Integrated Project: Rural Poverty

description.narrative: The Bahia State Integrated Project: Rural Poverty Project for Brazil will increase social and economic opportunities for the rural poor in Bahia by improving their access to basic socioeconomic infrastructure, thus contributing to the Borrower's objective of increasing the Human Development Indicator (HDI). The changes will, at the borrower's request and in fulfillment of the project development objective: (i) allocate previously unallocated loan proceeds in the amount of US$ 675,000; and (ii) revise the description of category two to include goods.

provider-org.narrative: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

condition.narrative: Borrower to carry out indigenous peoples participation Plan for community subprojects, with FUNAI assistance.
Borrower to enter into Grant Agreements with community associations
Borrower to maintain a project MIS in CAR
Borrower to provide Bank with FMR no later than 45 days after end each calendar quarter.
Borrower to provide annual operating plan (POA) satisfactory to Bank
CA to carry out the Project in accordance with the Operational Manual, the EMP and the IPP, in accordance with the approved annualoperating plans and respective budgets.
CAR declares its commitment to the objective of the Project and shall cause the Project to be carried out by CAR in accordancewiththe provisions of Article V of the General Conditions.
CAR to prepare and furnish to the Bank and annual operating plan and budget by October 30 of each year during Projectimplementation.
For the purposes of carrying out the Project, the Borrower shall maintain CAR with responsibilities, structure and functionssatisfactory to the Bank.
The Borrower shall monitor and evaluate the Project progress and prepare Project Reports covering one fiscal year.

title.narrative: Community benefited in project Area 1 and Area 2

comment.narrative: Min. 320 communities benefited in Area A1 and 480 in area A2
Phase 1 - Area 1 = 491 and Area 2 = 1,401Phase 2 - Area 1 = 259 and Area 2 = 767Total Area 1 = 750 and Area 2 = 2,168 I&EStudyresults will be reflected in the BCR and ICR.
Phase 1 - Area 1 = 491 and Area 2 = 1,401Phase 2 - Area 1 = 259 and Area 2 = 767Total Area 1 = 750 and Area 2 = 2,168

title.narrative: Reduction in incidence of water-borne disease in communities with water supply subprojects

comment.narrative: Min. 50% reduction in incidence of water-borne disease in communities with water supply subprojects

This is a Phase 2 indicator. I&E Study results will be reflected in the BCR and ICR. About 40,000 families were benefited withwater and sanitation subprojects. Results in water-borne disease reduction were measured in the I&E Study, but not yet available.
About 40,000 families were benefited with water and sanitation subprojects. Results in water-borne disease reduction were measuredin the I&E Study, but not yet available.

title.narrative: Productive investments generating full-time employment for beneficiary families

comment.narrative: Productive subprojects are min. 35% of total sub-projects completed, and generate incremental employment and income
This is a Phase 2 indicator and was fully achieved. I&E results will be reflected in the BCR and ICR
Women receive minimum 30% of all productive subprojects
This is a Phase 2 indicator and was fully achieved70% in Manioc Mill30% in Mechanization30%-40% other productive investments

title.narrative: 2,500 subproject investments implemented and maintained by community associations (cumulative).

baseline.value: 0% (Project taken as free-standing for data purposes)

target.value: 2,873 subprojects were financed, comprised of 1,835 subprojects in Phase 1 and 1,038 in Phase 2 (AF)

comment.narrative: At end of original project, actual results were 97% of target. Target now includes Phase 2 and has surpassed the total target .
Improved health and sanitation subprojects dominate (60% of total), with another 40% representing subprojects in support ofproductive inclusion (e.g., agricultural mechanization).

title.narrative: % Municipal Councils receiving training in HDI-M and Priority-setting

comment.narrative: Target fully achieved under Phase 1. Activities completed for Phase 2.
The State Secretariat of Agriculture (SEAGRI) is worked to consolidate municipal councils into a new model - SustainableDevelopment Municipal Councils, by an established deadline of June 30, 2013.

title.narrative: % Community associations receiving training in subproject management & operation

comment.narrative: Target fully achieved under Phase 1 and Phase 2.
As prerequisite for funds transfer, all community associations take part in training for subproject management, operation andmaintenance.

title.narrative: % of rural poor self-selecting into the Project, identifying and implementing subprojects.

comment.narrative: At end of Phase 1, PDO indicator was 98% of target value of 25%. Target value has been revised to reflect Phase 2. An I&E studywas completed and results will be reflected in the BCR and ICR
Under Phase 1, 168,000 families participated in the project and gained benefits from subprojects they have implemented. UnderPhase2 112,258 families have benefited

title.narrative: % CAR staff receiving TA and training for community associations and Municipal Councils

comment.narrative: Target substantially achieved under Phase 1. CAR conducted a series of regional training events for staff, which are dulyreflected in the indicator achievement.

178 events under Phase I with the participation of staff from CAR HQ in Salvador and all eight CAR regional offices statewide.Under Phase II, 383 CAR technical staff have taken part in training events.
